member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP.iDigitizePolygon(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CIMG,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as iDigitze2_EMAP, but automatically close polygons.
member.param: IMG for Z value, or <define>IMG_NULL</define> for no Z.
0 for no newline 1 for automatic newline at each point
Close the polygon if the selected location is within this radius in screen pixels.
member.remarks: This is the same as iDigitize2_EMAP, except that it automatically detects, (except for the 2nd and 3rd points) when a selected location is within the entered number of pixels from the starting point. If yes, the polygon is assumed to be closed, and the operation is the same as the RMB "done" command, and the process returns 0.
member.returns: 0 if user digitized some points. 1 if user cancelled.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP.iDigitizePeaks(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CIMG,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Digitise points from the current map and place in VVs.
member.param: IMG for Z value, or <define>IMG_NULL</define> for no Z.
0 for no newline 1 for automatic newline at each point
member.remarks: Same as iDigitize2_EMAP, but the closest peaks to the selected locations are returned instead of the selected location. The method chooses the highest value of the 8 surrounding points, the repeats this process until no higher value can be found in any of the 8 surrounding points. If there are two or more points with a higher value, it will just take the first one and continue, and this method will stall on flat areas as well (since no surrounding point is larger).
member.returns: 0 if user digitized some points. 1 if user cancelled.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP.iDigitize2(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CIMG,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Digitise points from the current map and place in VVs.
member.param: IMG for Z value, or <define>IMG_NULL</define> for no Z.
0 for no newline 1 for automatic newline at each point
member.remarks:
The command line will start to recieve digitized points from the mouse. Whenever the left mouse button is pressed, the current view X,Y are placed on the workspace command line. If a valid IMG is passed, the Z value is also placed on the command line. If auto-newline is specified, the line is immediately placed into the VVs, otherwise the user has the oportunity to enter data before pressing Enter.
Locations are in the current view user units
member.returns: 0 if user digitized some points. 1 if user cancelled.

IMG for Z value, or <define>IMG_NULL</define> for no Z.

The command line will start to recieve digitized points from the mouse. Whenever the left mouse button is pressed, the current view X,Y are placed on the workspace command line. member.summary: Unloads an edited map, optional prompt to save.
member.remarks: If the map is not loaded, nothing happens. If "FALSE", map is saved without a prompt.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP.UnLoad(System.String)
member.param: Name of the map to unload
member.remarks: If the MAP is not loaded, nothing happens. Same as UnLoadVerify_EMAP with FALSE to prompt save.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP.SetRedrawFlag(System.Int32)
member.remarks:
This function is generally used to prevent redrawing of the map, which normally occurs after the last UnLock_EMAP call, in cases where it is known that no changes are being made to the map.
Typical usage would be to call Lock_EMAP followed by SetRedrawFlag_EMAP (with <define>EMAP_REDRAW_NO</define>) prior to querying information from the map. And then end with a call to UnLock_EMAP.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP.Redraw
member.remarks: Redraws the map immediately. Map must not be locked.

member.summary: Print the current map to current printer.
member.param: lScaleToFit 0 - use scale factor 1 - fit to media 2 - fit to roll media

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP.MakeCurrent
member.summary: Makes this EMAP object the current active object to the user.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP.Lock
member.summary: This method locks the Edited map.
member.remarks: The Redraw flag is set to <define>EMAP_REDRAW_YES</define> when this functions is called.
member.returns: EMAP Object to map associated with edited map.

The last map in the list will be the current map.
Maps may already be loaded.

member.summary: Activates a group and associated tools.

E.g. a vector group will enable the edit toolbar for that gorup and an AGG will bring up the image color tool. Be sure to pass a combined name containing both the view name and the group separated by a "/" or "\".

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP.CopyToClip
member.remarks:
Four objects are placed on the clipboard:
1. Georefernce Text 2. Bitmap of current window screen resolution 3. EMF of current window screen resolution 4. Entire map as a Geosoft View (go to view mode and hit paste). The coordinates are placed in the current view coordinates.

member.name: T:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEMAP
member.summary: The EMAP class provides access to a map as displayed within Oasis montaj, but (usually) does not change data within the map itself. It performs functions such as setting the currently displayed area, or drawing "tracking" lines or boxes on the map (which are not part of the map itself).

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEDB.SetProfileSplitVV(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV)
member.param: Split VV (REAL) (relative sizes of each profile window)
member.remarks:
The input VV values are the fractional heights for each profile window. Values are summed, and normalized (so you can enter "1,1,1", with a VV of length 3, if you want 3 equal profile windows).
VV values beyond the maximum number of displayable profiles (<define>MAX_PROF_WND</define>) are ignored.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEDB.iDispClassChanLST(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CLST,System.String)
member.summary: Get a list of the displayed channels in a given channel class.
member.remarks:
Displayed channel lists are filled in the order the channels appear on the display, left to right.
The channel names will be placed in the "Name" part of the list and the values are set to the symbol handle.
Examples of channel classes in current use are "MASK" and "ASSAY". (Searches are case tolerant).
member.returns: Number of channels in the list. Terminates GX if there was an error.

member.param: Split VV (REAL) (profile window heights / entire profile window height)
member.remarks:
The returned VV is sized to the maximum number of profiles that can be displayed. If a profile is not currently displayed, its height fraction is 0. The sum of all the fractions returned is equal to 1.
The profile splits refers to the relative sizes of the individual profile windows. To get/set the fraction of the total database window devoted to the profiles, use the SetSplit_EDB and rGetSplit_EDB functions.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEDB.ApplyFormulaInternal(System.String)
member.summary:
Apply a formula to selected cells of the current line. (Do not use this wrapper if you want to apply a formula across multiple lines)
Notes:
The current selection must be on cell(s) of a channel or on the a channel header.
If the selection is on cell(s) of a channel, the formula is applied to only these cells.
If the selection is on a channel header, the formula is applied to every cell in the channel.
The given formula string must be of the form: "<NameOfCurrentChannel>=<SomeExpression>;" e.g. "x=y+1;"

member.name: T:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEDB
member.summary: The EDB class provides access to a database as displayed within Oasis montaj, but does not change data within the database itself. It performs functions such as setting the current line.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.CreateDrillholeParameterWeightConstraintDatabase(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CREG,System.String)
member.remarks:
Control parameters are passed in the REG (to allow for future expansion without the need to modify the wrappers). The input drillhole database must contain current X, Y and Z channels. Drillhole data should be equally spaced (or nearly so) down the hole. Weights are calculated on a circle perpendicular to the hole at each point.
RADIUS - Maximum radius from drillhole to create weighting points (Default = 100). INCRMENENT - Grid cell size in weighting circle (Default = 10). MINIMUM - the minimum weighting value to apply, at the radius (Default = 0.0001). POWER - Exponential power to use in the weighting function (negative of this is used) (Default = 2).

member.summary: Write data to an ASCII file.
member.param: List of channel names to write
member.remarks:
Channels to be written should be placed in a LST object.
Channels are written in the order of the list. Only the channel names in the list are used.
Data is formated as in the channel definition and channels are separated by a single space character.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.VoxelSection(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVOX,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Slice a voxel to a grid under a database line.
member.remarks:
Takes the first and XY locations in a line (using the current X and Y channels) and defines a section grid as a slice through a voxel file. The grid cell sizes can be left as <define>GS_R8DM</define>, in which case an attempt will be made to match the voxel cell size, based on the line azimuth, voxel rotation, etc.
If the slice does NOT intersect the voxel, or if there are fewer than 2 valid locations in the line, then no grid file is created, but there is no error. (This is to simplify creating multiple grids from at once, where not all may intersect).

member.summary: Simple re-fid of a channel based on a reference channel
member.remarks:
The original channel can be an array channel, in which case the columns are individually re-fidded.
ReFidCh_DU resamples the "Channel to refid" to the "Reference Channel" Fid range and increment.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.ReFidAllCh(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Simple re-fid of all channels based on a reference channel
member.remarks: Channels can be array channels, in which case the columns are individually re-fidded.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.ReFid(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Re-fid a channel based on a reference channel
member.param: Start Fid, if <define>GS_R8DM</define>, use ref channel minimum
Fid increment, if <define>GS_R8DM</define> use nominal spacing of the reference channel.
member.remarks:
The original channel can be an array channel, in which case the columns (up to the number of columns available in the output) are individually interpolated. If the number of columns in the output channel is more than the input channel, the remaining columns are dummied.
This function is fundamentally different in behaviour from ReFidCh_DU. The values in the Reference channel in ReFid_DU are the "X" locations corresponding to the "Y" locations in the "Original Channel". Output Channel values are calculated at the new "X" locations specified by the Start Fid and the Fid Increment.

member.remarks: The direction is calculated from the first and last non-dummy locations in the X and Y reference channels.
member.returns: direction in degrees azimuth (clockwise relative the +Y direction). <define>GS_R8DM</define> if the line has no data, or if there is a problem. Problems will register errors.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.QCInitSeparation(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates the nearest line channels for line separation QC.
member.remarks: This must be called before QCSeparation_DU. It uses a pager to establish the relative positions of the selected lines, then, for every point determines the closest point in another line to the left and to the right (as determined by looking in the direction of the line.) These distances are stored to two new channels in the database, "Closest_Left" and "Closest_Right"

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.Math(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CEXP)
member.summary: Apply an expression to the database
member.remarks:
The MATH_DU method will READWRITE lock channels on the left side of expressions and READONLY lock channels on the right side of expressions. Channels are unlocked before returning. Therefore, channels on the left side of an expression cannot be locked READONLY because the Math_DU attempt to lock the channel READWRITE will fail. Similarly, channels on the right side of an expression cannot be locked READWRITE because Math_DU's attempt to lock the channels READONLY will fail.
If this is confusing, just make sure no channels used in the expression are locked before calling Math_DU.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.Mask(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.LoadLTB(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CLTB,System.Int32)
member.summary: Load LTB into a database line.
member.remarks:
A new channel will be created for all LTB fields that do not already exist. The LTB field type will be double if all entries can be converted to double, otherwise it will be a string type set to the larger of 16 characters or the longest string in the field.
For _APPEND, the LTB data is simply added the end of each channel. ReFidAllCh_DU can be used to re-fid data to match a specifc channel and there-by case all channels to be the same length before appending data.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.LoadGravityCG6ToLine(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Load a CG-6 gravity survey file. Specify the name of the output line
member.param: line name - can be empty in which case it will create a line name from the input file name
member.remarks: Has its own format - space-delimited columns of data

member.summary: Load a CG-6 gravity survey file.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.LoadGravity(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CREG,System.Int32,System.String)
member.param: Line in which to load data
member.remarks:
See GRAVITY.DAT for a description of the file format.
Existing data in the line will be replaced.
The following REG parameters will be set if they appear in the data file: default OPERATOR "" DATE none INSTRUMENT "" INSTRUMENT_SCALE "1.0" BASE_GRAVITY "0.0" FORMULA "1967" GMT_DIFF "0.0" DISTANCE_UNITS "m" DENSITY_EARTH "2.67" DENSITY_WATER "1.0" DENSITY_ICE "0.95" MAP_PROJECTION ""
If the corresponding constant is not specified and the REG already has the constant defined, it is not changed. If the constant is not defined and it is not already in the REG, the indicated default will be set.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.LabTemplate(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.param: Offset to column labels line (0 for first line)
Offset to unit labels line, -1 if none
Offset to first line that contains data
Sample channel element type, recommend -10 for 10-character ASCII, or <define>GS_LONG</define> for numbers.
member.remarks:
The template can be used to import the file using sImportBIN_DU.
The first column is assumed to be the sample number.
If the unit label line is the same as the column label line, column labels are assummed to be followed by unit labels using the format "Au-ppm", "Au ppm" or "Au(ppm)".
The number of channels is determined from the number of columns in the data channel. If there are more column labels or unit labels, the last labels are assumed to be correct. If there are fewer line labels, default labels "Col_n", where n is the column number, will be created and no unit labels will be defined.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.IntersectTBLtoGDB(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new intersection database from an intersection table.
member.remarks: If the GDB exists, it is deleted, so it should not be loaded. The database is split by Tie lines (or whatever lines are found in column 3 of the TBL file.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.IntersectOld(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Use existing intersection table and re-calculate miss-ties.
member.remarks: Reads intersection information from an existing intersect table and looks up the values at the intersections for the input Z channel. This makes it unnecessary to re-calculate the intersections every time if you want to determine miss-ties using different Z channels, or the same Z channel after processing levelling corrections. Existing intersections whose locations do not exist in the database are ignored.

member.summary: Create a new intersection table from an intersection database.
member.remarks: If the TBL exists, it is overwritten.

Oasis montaj line name to create (overrides template value)

1. The import template can be in the local directory or the GEOSOFT directory.
2. Only the import template must be specified. The Geodatabase connection string and Oasis line name are normally taken from the template file itself, but if these values are provided, they will override those found in the template.

Imported table in database file (overrides template value)
Oasis Montaj line name to create (overrides template value)

1. The import template can be in the local directory or the GEOSOFT directory. The import data file must include the path if it is not in the local directory.
2. Only the import template must be specified. The database file name, file type, the database table and Oasis line name are normally taken from the template file itself, but if these values are provided, they will override those found in the template.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.ImportDAARC500SerialGPS(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Import Serial GPS data from the RMS Instruments DAARC500.
member.remarks:
Imports GPS data stored in a serial channel recorded by the RMS Instruments DAARC500 instrument, and outputs the data to a line in the database. Makes the following channels:
Fid, UTC_Time, Latitude, Longitude, Altitude, GPS_Quality, NumSat (Number of satellites), GPS_HDOP (Horizontal Dilution of Position), Undulation, GPS_DiffAge (Age of differential channel).

member.summary: Import blocked binary or archive ASCII data with data error display
member.remarks:
1. Binary import templates have extension .I2 by convention. See BINARY.I2 for a description of the template format. Archive import templates have extension .I3 by convention. See ARCHIVE.I3 for a description of the template format.
2. Both the import template and data file must exist.
3. If a line already exists in the database, a new version is created unless a line name is passed in. In this case, the specified name is used and the imported channels on the previous line will be destroyed.

3. If a line already exists in the database, a new version is created unless a line name is passed in. In this case, the specified name is used and the imported channels on the previous line will be destroyed.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.ImportAMIRA(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CRA,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CWA)
member.remarks:
All the constant declarations are stored within the database under \TEM\CONSTANTS. The format is as follows:
1. Lines stored in the file beginning with "/" are comments 2. Each constant occupies a line in the file. It uses the format: CONSTANT=VALUE

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.ImportAllDAO(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Import an entire external database using DAO.
member.remarks:
1. The file is assumed to be a DAO compliant database.
2. The import data file must include the path if it is not in the local directory.
3. For group storage, the table names are imported "as is". For line storage, if the table names are valid Geosoft line names, they are used as is. Otherwise, line names will be created with type LINE_NORMAL, starting at L0 and incrementing by 10 (L10, L20 etc.)
4. If the line exists, the data will overwrite the existing data.
5. All tables and fields will be imported.
6. The following are valid type strings for DAO:
MSJET : Microsoft Access ODBC : ODBC source dBASE III dBASE IV dBASE 5 FoxPro 2.0 FoxPro 2.5 FoxPro 2.6 Paradox 3.x Paradox 4.x Paradox 5.x

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.ImportAllADO(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Import an entire external database using ADO.
member.remarks:
1. For group storage, the table names are imported "as is". For line storage, if the table names are valid Geosoft line names, they are used as is. Otherwise, line names will be created with type LINE_NORMAL, starting at L0 and incrementing by 10 (L10, L20 etc.)
2. If the line exists, the data will overwrite the existing data.
3. All tables and fields will be imported.
4. If connection string is of type "FILENAME=..." the connection will attempt to resolve it as a file database. (see also ODBCFileConnect_GUI)

3. If the line already exists, the data will overwrite the existing data.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.GetChanDataVV(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.Int32,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV)
member.summary: Populate a VV with unique items in a channel.
member.remarks: Items from all selected lines are collected, sorted, and duplicates removed. The data is collected in the channel's data type, so normal Sort_VV rules apply. If the output VV and channel type are not the same, then the data is converted using the Copy_VV function, so see that for conversion rules. If a mask channel is selected, then only those items where the mask channel is not a dummy are collected.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.GetChanDataLST(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.Int32,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CLST)
member.summary: Populate a LST with unique items in a channel.
member.remarks: Items from all selected lines are collected, sorted, and duplicates removed. The output LST name and value are set to the item values. Non-string channels are converted internally to string values using Copy_VV, so results may differ from what you may expect given the current channel's display width and number of decimals. If a mask channel is selected, then only those items where the mask channel is not a dummy are collected.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.ExportXYZ(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Export XYZdata from a database to an XYZ file.
member.remarks:
1. The export template can be in the local directory or the GEOSOFT directory. The import data file must include the path if it is not in the local directory.
2. Both the import template and data file must exist.
3. Sample Template file
[EXPORT XYZ] EXPORT CHAN {,FORMAT} {,WIDTH} {,DECIMAL} WRITEDUMMY YES CLIPMAP YES MAXPOINTS 1000 INCREMENT .5
4. This can be used to export a group, but the group must be the currently displayed line, and only that group will be exported.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.Export(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.String,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,System.Int32,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: List of channels - channel symbols stored as INT
Include a header with channel names?
member.remarks:
For databases with both groups and lines: If both lines and groups are selected, save only the lines. If no lines are selected, (only groups), save the current line if it is (1) a group and (2) selected, else save the first selected group. --- Option to filter out data where one of the channels has a dummy in it. Option to allow a header with the channel names.
The <define>DU_CHANNELS_DISPLAYED</define> option can be used to export any selection of channels, listed by the symbols (DB_SYMB) values, cast to int values and stored in a VV.

Reset starting fiducials to zero (0: No, 1: Yes)

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.BreakLineToGroups(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Break up a line into group-lines based on a channel.
member.param: Class name for new group lines (can be "")
member.remarks: The original line will be deleted. This is similar to BreakLine_DU, but the output lines are "group" lines, without the line type letters at the start. (See db.gxh for information of Group Lines). All channels are associated with each group line, and the input class name is assigned to each group. Class names for groups ensure that (for instance) if you add a new channel to one group of a given class, it will get added to all other groups in the same class. If the class name is left empty, then this will NOT be true. (Groups without class names are treated as isolated entities for the purposes of channel loading).

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.AvgAzimuth(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Returns average azimuth of selected lines.
member.remarks: Direction in degrees azimuth (clockwise relative the +Y direction). The result is in the range -90 < azimuth <= 90. The method handles lines going in opposite directions (they do not average to 0!) The method takes a precision, which is used to generate a series of "test" angles. The dot product of the line directions is taken with each of the test angles, and the absolute values summed. The maximum value occurs at the angle which most closely approximates the trend direction of the lines.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU.Append(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.Int32)
member.summary: Append a source database onto a destination database.
member.param: Ignore write protection on channels? (TRUE or FALSE)
member.remarks:
If the source database and destination database have channels with the same name, then data is appended onto the end of the channel in lines which have the same number.
If a channel in the destination database is not also in the source database, it is ignored.

member.name: T:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDU
member.summary: DU functions provide a variety of common utilities that can be applied efficiently to the contents of a database. Most DU library functions take as their first argument a DB object, and apply standard processes to data stored in an OASIS database, including import and export functions.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDOCU.SetMETA(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CMETA)
member.param: META to add to the document's meta

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDOCU.SetFileMeta(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the document from a file source with metadata.
member.param: Document name, if NULL use file name
member.remarks:
See SetFile_DOCU. This function is the same as sSetFile_DOCU, plus insures that a META exists that includes the "Data" class. If the file has associated metadata, either supported natively in the file, or through an associated file "filename.extension.GeosoftMeta", that metadata will be loaded into the DOCU meta, and a Data class will be constructed if one does not exist.
Also, the Document type Extension is very important in that it specifies the document types that natively have metadata. The ones currently supported are:
"map" Geosoft map file "gdb" Geosoft database "grd" Geosoft grid file

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDOCU.SetFile(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Set the document from a file source.
member.param: Document name, if "" file name will be used
member.remarks:
Document types are normally identified by their extension. If you leave the document type blank, the extension of the document file will be used as the document type.
To resolve conflicting types, you can define your own unique type by entering your own type "extension" string.
The following types are pre-defined (as are any normal Geosoft file types):
"htm" HTML "html" HTML "txt" ASCII text file "doc" Word for Windows document "pdf" Adobe PDF "map" Geosoft map file "mmap" Mapinfo map file (real extension "map") "grd" Geosoft grid file "gdb" Geosoft database
URL Document Links
The document name can be a URL link to the document using one of the supported protocols. The following protocols are supported:
http://www.mywebserver.com/MyFile.doc - HTTP dap://my.dap.server.com/dcs?DatasetName?MyFile.doc - DAP (DAP Document Access) ftp://my.ftp.server.com/Dir1/MyFile.doc - FTP protocol
The full file name will be stored but no data will be stored with the DOCU class and the document can be retrieved using the sGetFile_DOCU method.

member.remarks: Use this before calling the ReplotHoles functions, so that, instead of creating a new map, the plotting functions use the existing one.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.SetIPJ(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CIPJ)
member.remarks: The projection for the project is the projection stored in the DH_EAST channel in the collar table. This function sets the projection of the (DH_EAST, DH_NORTH) channel pairs in each of the project databases to the input IPJ. The input IPJ cannot be a geographic coordinate system or this call will fail with an error message.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.SetInfo(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.remarks: If the DH_ELEV channel is requested it will also search for the DH_RL channel, which is the new name for the collar elevation.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.SetCurrentViewName(System.String)
member.summary: Set the current map view name.
member.remarks: Can be used to specify the name of the view to plot into.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.SetCrookedSectionIPJ(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CIPJ)
member.summary: Pass the Crooked projection required for plotting to a crooked section.
member.remarks: This might be extracted from an existing crooked section view, or created from a database line.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.SelectPLY2(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CPLY,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Select holes in PLY (Polygon) object with options.
member.remarks:
The various selection options give the following results:
New/Select/inside: Unselect all holes, then select all holes inside the polygon. New/Select/outside: Unselect all holes, then select all holes outside the polygon. New/Deselect/inside: Select all holes, then deselect all holes inside the polygon. New/Deselect/outside: Select all holes, then deselect all holes outside the polygon.
Append/Select/inside: Select all holes inside the polygon. Leave selections outside as is. Append/Select/outside: Select all holes outside the polygon. Leave selections inside as is. Append/Deselect/inside: Deselect all holes inside the polygon Leave selections outside as is. Append/Deselect/outside: Deselect all holes outside the polygon. Leave selections inside as is.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.SelectPLY(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CPLY)
member.summary: Select all holes in PLY (Polygon) object.
member.remarks: This function operates the same as the SelectPLY2_DH method with parameters (1, 0, 0)

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.SelectName(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Select holes using a name mask.
member.remarks: Overwrite mode - all selections tested and selected or not selected Append mode - only holes matching the mask are selected or not selected.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.SelectHoles(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,System.Int32)
member.remarks: Indices less than 0 are skipped. This lets you use this function after a call to FindItems_LST, which returns -1 for indices not located.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.SaveDataParametersINI(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.String)
member.summary: Save data parameters to INI files..
member.remarks: Wholeplot data graphing parameters for each channel are stored in the channel REG. This function lets a user transfer pre-defined settings to individual INI files (eg. cu.ini). As of v6.3, the DH object is NOT required for this function, and is, in fact, ignored.

member.summary: Resurvey a hole with straight segments between locations.
member.param: Minimum hole depth to start output values
Maximum hole depth for output values
member.remarks: Calculate (X, Y, Z) locations down the hole from azimuth, dip, depth values, assuming each segment is straight, and the hole bends at each successive azimuth, dip, depth value. The collar is assumed to be at zero depth, and depth is the measure distance down the hole (even if it's horizontal). A negative dip convention means vertical down is -90 degrees.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.ReSurveyStraight(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV)
member.param: Minimum hole depth to start output values
Maximum hole depth for output values
member.remarks: Assumes a straight hole to calculate (X, Y, Z) locations down the hole from azimuth, dip, depth values. The collar is assumed to be at zero depth, and depth is the measure distance down the hole (even if it's horizontal). A negative dip convention means vertical down is -90 degrees.

member.summary: Use radius of curvature resurveying method.
member.param: Minimum hole depth to start output values
Maximum hole depth for output values
member.remarks: Uses the Radius of curvature method to calculate (X, Y, Z) locations down the hole from azimuth, dip, depth values. The collar is assumed to be at zero depth, and depth is the measure distance down the hole (even if it's horizontal). A negative dip convention means vertical down is -90 degrees.

member.summary: Use the polynomial fit resurveying method.
member.param: Minimum hole depth to start output values
Maximum hole depth for output values
member.remarks: Uses the polynomial fit method to calculate (X, Y, Z) locations down the hole from azimuth, dip, depth values. The collar is assumed to be at zero depth, and depth is the measure distance down the hole (even if it's horizontal). A negative dip convention means vertical down is -90 degrees. The polynomial order must be in the range 1-20, with 5 being adequate for most smoothly curving holes. The order is reduced to no more than the number of input points.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.ReSurveyEastNorth(System.String,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@)

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.IGetTemplateInfoEx(System.String,System.Int32@,System.String@,System.Int32,System.String@,System.Int32,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CLST)
member.summary: Retrieve the file, DH Table name, type and channel list from an import template.
member.param: File name (blank for ODBC, or undefined).
member.remarks:
As of version 6.0, the import templates (*.i3, *.i4) produced by the Wholeplot import wizards contain the following lines:
FILE assay.txt (except for ODBC) DRILLTYPE 3 DRILLTABLE Assay
The FILE is normally the input file name, except for ODBC, where it is not defined. The DRILLTYPE is one of DH_DATA_XXX, and the DRILLTABLE is the name of the Wholeplot database table; e.g. Project_Assay.gdb in the above case. The DRILLTABLE is only included in the template for <define>DH_DATA_FROMTO</define> and <define>DH_DATA_POINT</define>, but this function will return the appropriate table names (e.g. Collar, Survey, ENSurvey) for the other types. If the DRILLTYPE is NOT found in the template, a value of <define>DH_DATA_UNKNOWN</define> is returned for the data type; likely an indication that this is not a new-style template produced by Wholeplot. This version also returns a list of the channels in the template checks can be made to see if the import will exceed the database channel limit.

member.summary: Retrieve the file, DH Table name, type and channel list from an import template.
member.param: File name (blank for ODBC, or undefined).
member.remarks:
As of version 6.0, the import templates (*.i3, *.i4) produced by the Wholeplot import wizards contain the following lines:
FILE assay.txt (except for ODBC) DRILLTYPE 3 DRILLTABLE Assay
The FILE is normally the input file name, except for ODBC, where it is not defined. The DRILLTYPE is one of DH_DATA_XXX, and the DRILLTABLE is the name of the Wholeplot database table; e.g. Project_Assay.gdb in the above case. The DRILLTABLE is only included in the template for <define>DH_DATA_FROMTO</define> and <define>DH_DATA_POINT</define>, but this function will return the appropriate table names (e.g. Collar, Survey, ENSurvey) for the other types. If the DRILLTYPE is NOT found in the template, a value of <define>DH_DATA_UNKNOWN</define> is returned for the data type; likely an indication that this is not a new-style template produced by Wholeplot. This version also returns a list of the channels in the template checks can be made to see if the import will exceed the database channel limit.

member.summary: Retrieve the import template from the database.
member.param: Name of template file to extract to.
member.remarks:
The template can be retrieved in order to refresh the database with a call to the DHIMPORT.GX.

If no template blob exists, templ

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.iGetTemplateBlob(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Retrieve the import template from the database.
member.param: Name of template file to extract to.
member.remarks:
The template can be retrieved in order to refresh the database with a call to the DHIMPORT.GX.
The import types correspond to the DHIMPORT.IMPTYPE variable: 0: ASCII, 1: Database/XLS, 2: ODBC
If no template blob exists, templ
member.returns: 0: No template stored in the database 1: Template retrieved and written to a file.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.ConvertOldLineNames(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CLST)
member.remarks:
The input LST must be filled using a function like SymbLST_DB, which puts the name and symbol into the LST items. Any names with a period are truncated at the period, and the line name in the database is changed to the new name (just the hole name). The LST is modified to have the new names. A value is put into the DB REG "DH_CONVERTED_NAMES" parameter so this process is done only once on a database.
DO NOT use on old-style single-database Wholeplot projects.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.PunchGridHoles(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CIMG,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,System.Double)
member.summary: Dummy out locations in a grid around non-contact holes.
member.remarks: Grid is dummied out to the blanking distance around holes where the input Z value is dummy. If a contacting hole is closer then twice the blanking distance, the blanking distance is reduced accordingly. Distances are measured horizontally (e.g. Z is ignored). If the blanking distance is zero or dummy, the distance is automatically set to half the distance to the closest hole intersection.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.LithoGrid3D(System.String,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CTPAT,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CREG,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a lithology voxel grid with lith codes mapped to single values.
member.param: Name of VOX Persistent Storage file
Max gap to skip when compositing (<define>GS_R8DM</define> for none)
Rangrid control REG (see RGRD class for parameters)
member.remarks: Values in the input channel are assigned the index of the corresponding item found in the input TPAT. The compositing gap refers to the size of gaps in the data (either a blank lithology or missing from-to interval) which will be ignored when compositing lithologies into contiguous from-to intervals. The non-contact radius is used to dummy out the level grids around holes where the gridded lithology is not found. If not specified (dummy) then half the distance to the nearest contacting hole is used.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.iGridIntersection(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.String,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Algorithm to determine the intersection of a straight hole with a surface (DEM) grid.
member.remarks: Given a point on the hole and the straight hole dip and azimuth, ocate (an) intersection point with the input DEM grid.
member.returns: 1 if an intersection is found, 0 if not.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDH.GetOrientedCoreDipDir(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CLST,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Converted alpha/beta values in oriented cores to dip/dip direction.
member.param: List of holes to process (e.g. from HoleLST_DH)
Channel code for input alpha data
Channel code for input beta data
1: Top of core reference 0: Bottom of core reference
Channel name for output dip data
Channel name for output dip direction
member.remarks: The input data are the oriented core alpha and beta values, using either top or bottom reference. The values for each hole in the LST are converted to "absolute" dip and dip-direction values, using the resurveyed hole orientations at each depth. The alpha and beta data must be from the same database, and the output dip and dip/dir channels are written to the same database.

member.param: Max gap to skip when compositing (<define>GS_R8DM</define> for none)
member.remarks: For the input LST of holes, returns XYZ location of top or bottom contact with the input geology. Those selected holes which do NOT have contacts, return <define>rDUMMY</define> for the corresponding locations.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CDGW.SetTitle(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the title of the dialog.
member.remarks:
A "Special", additional title can be added to a dialog by passing a title to SetTitle_DGW with the following syntax:
"Window Title\nAdditional Title"
In the title argument, a line break character '\n' is used to separate the parts.
The window title free_appears as the title in the upper bar of the dialog. The additional title free_appears below this, in the main body of the dialog, and is separated from the rest of the fields by a horizontal line. It is printed in the bold version of the default font (or of the special font specified using the MONTAJ.GX_TITLE_FONT parameter noted above in "Setting Fonts in GX dialogs."

Mask color; overrides symbol color. Pass an empty string to iColor_MVIEW for no plot.
Symbol size override. Set to 0.0 to use class file symbol sizes.
Plot Grid lines? (0: Just outside edge tics, 1: Grid lines).
member.remarks: Plot a tri-plot using symbols based on a symbol class file.

member.summary: Plot a tri-plot using colors based on a zone file. Optional data masking with masking color. Optional database linking.
member.param: X location (bottom left corner of box)

Decorated font name, "" for default symbol font (normally symbols.gfn)
Plot Grid lines? (0: Just outside edge tics, 1: Grid lines).
member.remarks: Plot a tri plot using colors based on a zone file.

member.summary: Plot a tri-plot using a single fixed symbol. Optional data masking with masking color. Optional database linking.
member.param: X location (bottom left corner of box)

member.summary: Plot the TriPlot on a map using symbol number, size and color VVs.
member.param: X location (bottom left corner of box)
Decorated font name, "" for default symbol font (normally symbols.gfn)
Colors if symbol number or color == 0, do not plot
Plot Grid lines? (0: Just outside edge tics, 1: Grid lines).
member.remarks: The mask channel VV is used for plotting precedence; those points with mask = dummy are plotted first, then overwritten with the non-masked values, so you don't get "good" points being covered up by masked values. The view scaling is not altered with any projection. The base view is best as the input.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.StackedBarPlot(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CMVIEW,System.String,System.String,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)

member.param: Data handles, stored as INT values
Single bar width in data units.
member.remarks: The number of channels is taken from the Data handles VV. Plots a bar plot with the center of the "X" axis at the symbol location. See the note on offset symbols in RosePlot_CHIMERA

member.summary: Set data back into a database.
member.param: [i] (INT) input data - one VV handle per channel
[i] number of original data items in each line
[i] init channel values to dummies first (0:No, 1:Yes)?
member.remarks:
This function would normally be called after AAGetLithogeochemData_CHIMERA to write processed values back into a database, in the correct lines, and in the correct fiducial locations wrt the other data. The book-keeping VVs would all be set up in AAGetLithogeochemData_CHIMERA.
Values NOT in the data (missing indices) will be initialized to dummy if the channel is new, or if the value in the last VV below is set to 1.
New channel types will be set using the data VV type. Any metadata (CLASS, display formats) should be set separately.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.RosePlot2(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CMVIEW,System.String,System.String,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Same as RosePlot_CHIMERA, with a starting angle.
member.param: Data handles, stored as INT values
Starting angle in degrees CCW from horizontal (<define>rDUMMY</define> gives 0.0)
member.remarks: The starting angle is the location of the edge of the first pie slice, counted in degrees counter-clockwise from horizontal (3 o'clock). Zero degrees gives the same plot as RosePlot_CHIMERA.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.RosePlot(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CMVIEW,System.String,System.String,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Plot a Rose plot of up to 8 channels.
member.param: Data handles, stored as INT values
member.remarks:
The number of channels is taken from the Data handles VV. The values in each data VV give the radius, in view units, of the sector arc to plots. Values <=0 or dummies are not plotted.
Offset symbols: When selected, the symbols plot without overlap, away from the original locations. The original location is marked with a small symbol and a line joins the original position and the relocated symbol. Care should be taken when choosing the symbol size, because if the point density is too high, all the points will get pushed to the outside edge and your plot will look like a hedgehog (it also takes a lot longer!).

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.OrderedChannelLST(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CLST)
member.summary: Fill a list with the channels in the preferred order.
member.remarks:
Loads a LST with all channels in the preferred order:
First: Sample, E, N, assay channels, Middle: Data from survey (other channels), Last: Duplicate, Standard, Chemmask (and other masks), weight, lab, batch
If the input LST object has values, it is used as the channel LST, otherwise, get all the database channels. (This allows you to pass in the currently displayed channels and only reload those).

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.MaskChanLST(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CLST)
member.summary: Load a LST with mask channels.
member.remarks:
Loads a LST with all channels with CLASS "MASK", as well as all channels containing the string "MASK", as long as the CLASS for these channels is not set to something other than "" or "MASK".
This function has been duplicated by MaskChanLST_DB, which is safe to use in applications which do not have CHIMERA loaded.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.LaunchTriplot(System.String)
member.summary: Launch Triplot tool on a database.
member.remarks:
The Triplot tool uses the following INI parameters
================ =============================================== TRIPLOT.TTM name of the triplot template, "none" for none ---------------- ----------------------------------------------- TRIPLOT.TTM_NAME name of last template section, "" for none. ---------------- ----------------------------------------------- TRIPLOT.X name of channel to display in X ---------------- ----------------------------------------------- TRIPLOT.Y name of channel to display in Y ---------------- ----------------------------------------------- TRIPLOT.Z name of channel to display in Z ---------------- ----------------------------------------------- TRIPLOT.MASK name of channel to use for mask ================ ===============================================
The database should be a currently open database.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.LaunchScatter(System.String)
member.summary: Launch scatter tool on a database.
member.remarks:
The scatter tool uses the following INI parameters
================ =============================================== SCATTER.STM name of the scatter template, "none" for none ---------------- ----------------------------------------------- SCATTER.STM_NAME name of last template section, "" for none. ---------------- ----------------------------------------------- SCATTER.X name of channel to display in X ---------------- ----------------------------------------------- SCATTER.Y name of channel to display in Y ---------------- ----------------------------------------------- SCATTER.MASK name of channel to use for mask ================ ===============================================
The database should be a currently open database. This function supercedes LaunchScatter_EDB, (which now just gets the name of the EDB and calls this function).

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.LaunchProbability(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Launch probability tool on a database.
member.remarks: The database should be a currently open database.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.GetTransform(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CDB,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Get channel transform options and lambda values.
member.remarks:
If the lambda transform is requested, the channel must have the lambda value defined.
Input Transform options
-1 - Channel default (will be either raw or log) 0 - Raw Transform 1 - Log transform: base e with log min = CHIMERA_LOG_MIN 2 - Lambda transform

member.summary: Get all rows of non-dummy data in a database.
member.param: [i] dummy row if this channel value is dummy (0:No, 1:Yes)? Effective only if "remove dummy rows" value is TRUE
[i] warn if rows removed because of dummy data items?
[o] (INT) returned data - one VV handle per channel
[o] number of original data items in each line
member.remarks:
This function is a quick way to get all rows of data, guaranteeing no dummy items. Book-keeping VVs returned let you easily write back results to new channels in the correct locations. Set the "Dummy Row" VV to 1 if you wish to remove any row where a value for the corresponding channel is a dummy.
Transforms to apply:
-1 - Channel default (will be either raw or log) 0 - Raw Transform 1 - Log transform: base e with log min = CHIMERA_LOG_MIN 2 - Lambda transform

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.ClipToDetectLimit(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Apply detection limit clipping of data.
member.remarks:
Flow:
1. If auto-converting negatives, then all negative values are replaced by -0.5*value, and detection limit is ignored.
2. If not auto-converting negatives, and the detection limit is not <define>rDUMMY</define>, then values less than the detection limit are converted to one-half the detection limit.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.CategorizeByValueDetLimit(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,System.Double,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV)
member.summary: Transform values to the index of input data ranges, with detection limit.
member.remarks: Same as CategorizeByValue_CHIMERA, but if the input value is less than the detection limit, the output value is set to zero.

member.name: M:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.CCHIMERA.CategorizeByValue(GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV,GeoEngine.Core.GXNet.CVV)
member.summary: Transform values to the index of input data ranges.
member.remarks:
A list of minima (e.g. M1, M2, M3, M4, M5) is input. A list of values V is input and transformed to outputs N in the following manner:
if(V) >= M5) N = 5 else if(V) >= M4) N = 4 ... ... else if(V) >= M1) N = 1 else N = 0

member.summary: Is like INSERT, except that it is only used to add fids to the start or end of the existing data. The data is not moved with repect to the current fid locations.

member.name: F:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.DU_MODFIDConstant.DELETE
member.summary: Will delete the range of fids.

member.name: F:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.DU_MODFIDConstant.INSERT
member.summary: Will insert fid range by moving data. Inserted range will always be dummied out. If the insertion point is before start of data, the fid start is changed.

member.summary: Interpolate between values, extrapolate beyond two ends

member.summary: Interpolate between values, constant end values beyond two ends

member.summary: Interpolate between values, dummy beyond two ends

member.name: F:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.DU_LOOKUPConstant.INTERPCLOSE
member.summary: Same as _INTERPOLATE mode except that the target value must be within the CLOSE distance to a table value. a) the primary index channel for single index lookups; b) the secondary index channel for double index lookups. Values not in data spacing are dummy.

member.name: F:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.DU_LOOKUPConstant.NEARESTCLOSE
member.summary: Same as _NEAREST mode except that the target value must be within the CLOSE distance to a table value. a) the primary index channel for single index lookups; b) the secondary index channel for double index lookups. Values not in data spacing are dummy.

member.name: F:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.DU_LOOKUPConstant.INTERPOLATE
member.summary: The same as _NEAREST, except that the value will be interpolated between the two nearest framing values in the table.

member.name: F:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.DU_LOOKUPConstant.NEAREST
member.summary: Requires that the first index match exactly. The nearest second index will be used for the finding the lookup value. The results will be dummy only if the first index does not have a match.

member.name: F:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.DU_LOOKUPConstant.EXACT
member.summary: Requires an exact match in all indexes. Results will dummy if Indexes are not found.

member.name: F:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.DU_LAB_TYPEConstant.COMMA

member.name: F:Geosoft.Desktop.GXNet.DU_LAB_TYPEConstant.FREE
member.summary: The delimiter string identifies characters to be used as delimiters. Use C style escape sequences to identify non-printable characters. The default delimiters for FREE format files are " \t,".
